description: As the valley expands, the hills clear way and trees give room for buildings.
the city of the Hill Giants expands out to the east, bustling with activity.
12610.name: Valley

description: the path continues north and south from here
While passing thru the woods here, all seems a little more quiet
than normal.  Rustling seems to be coming from the east, but no sign
of anything can be seen here.  Perhaps a little farther down the
path...
12600.name: Forest Path

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12622.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12635.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12632.name: Outlook Trail

description: Here sits the bones of a warrior, the last living signs of Darren
Xavier Orcbane sit in this hole...  His sons sought this place for a
long time yet never was it found until you arrived....
12652.name: Darren's Final Home

description: the underbrush here has clearly been removed on purpose...
At first glance, these limbs look broken off.  On closer inspection
they're definitely bitten off, you can see clear tooth marks but at
jagged ugly angles...
At first glance, these limbs look broken off.  On closer inspection
they're definitely bitten off, you can see clear tooth marks but at
jagged ugly angles...
the underbrush here has clearly been removed on purpose...
More and more of the trees in this area are starting to show signs
of damage.  Alot of the limbs around the path are broken off, some
even look bitten off, but by what.  Some of the underbrush looks as
tho it has been charred by fire and cleared for the sake of removing
possible hiding spots...
12601.name: Forest Path

description: The walls and floor are covered in a think layer of hides.
Sleeping in the middle of the room is the largest hill giant
you have seen. Resting in his sleeping arms is a large
battle axe.
12617.name: Choral's House

description: the bones of they who have made it to the gate of this stronghold litter the ground here...
The ground is littered in bones and broken weapons,
several beds of tree branches and animal hides are
ramdomly placed around the lair.
12604.name: Front Station

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12633.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12636.name: Outlook Trail

description: considering i've not decided to whom this hill giant clan makes their worship, this shrine still remains unnamed
12618.name: Shrine to ?????

description: This room is only for store of wilgigs summonable pet
12668.name: Path between the Hills

description: Upon entering this branch of the caverns, the slight tinge of an
odor hits your nose.  This shaft must be fairly foul as you progress
farther down it for the stink to be this bad here.  At best guess,
this must be the shaft to the disposal.
12650.name: A Stinking Shaft

description: To the north is a wooden hut, covered in bear fur,
with the skulls of five dragons above the doorway. To the
south quafs the smell of cooking meat. Loud snoring
comes from the east from a larger house made of
polished walnut logs.
12616.name: Intersection

description: Set up an observation room here and put in a mob with an mprog that
will move him to the gate room and alert the guards if i can do that
then i wanna make it so the guards are sleeping on the bed, unless
they're alerted
12609.name: observation post

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12626.name: Outlook Trail]

description: i donno wether i wanna dig down here or put a portal in for the entrance
done
12613.name: 3h

description: Carved into the west wall are two giant gates. They are
made of the same ice as the very ice of the cavern. Only
a soft glow around the edges betray their existanse.
12648.name: Ice Cavern

description: The pales are made of long large tree trunks, each sharpened to a point.
The wall is made from very large tree trunks each sharpened to a point.
A palisade stands looming before you.  Its wooden pales are made
from the trunks of very large trees.  The walls are covered with the
scares of battle.  Lighting, fire balls, and meteor sworms may have
done the damage you see.  Heavy voices can be heard coming from behind
the gate.
12603.name: The Palisade

description: 2h
12612.name: 2h

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12630.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path leading off in this direction falls in the valley between
two hills.  Among the debris on the ground are some bones and weapons,
all smashed, and a few busted boulders, among the whole ones.  The
remains of any number of warriors that have tried to pass this way
litter the ground, even more dense near the underbrush to the sides...
12605.name: Walking the Valley

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12637.name: 1h

description: some of the missing branches have been inverted and jammed into the ground at heinous angles...
this area was obviously cleared for use as a battleground...
A wide pile of dust, ash, and broken burnt wood debris lies where a
fire of epic proportions must have been
The path opens here into the start of a clearing.  Most of the
growth here looks as tho it might wish it were elsewhere, it's all
either twisted or destroyed in some way.  Branches are broken off and
jammed into the ground in some places, shattered and left for debris
in others.  Some remnants of what might have been a bonfire of epic
proportions sit to one side.  As the clearing continues to the south,
a wall or gate stands a short ways away.
12602.name: Forest Path

description: Here at the end of this rocky shaft is the garbage pit.  You can
tell this is the garbage pit because of both the odor coming from it
and the stains leading into it.  The odor is definitely that of
refuse, garbage, feces, and god knows what else.  You also notice one
other thing...  A slight niche in the wall to the north...
12651.name: A Rocky Shaft

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12634.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12624.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12625.name: Outlook Trail

description: Broken weapons are piled in the south west corner. Nothing looks
as if it would be of any good. Several logs lay on the floor next to
a work table with wood working tools. A half carved club lays on the
table.
12621.name: Armory

description: From the north rings the laughter of a woman and children.
The lvery arge door is closed above the door hangs the skulls
of many creatures, some of them appear to be humanoid. Just
south is a blacked building. The road continues east.
12615.name: An Intersection

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12628.name: Outlook Trail

description: A giantess plays with two giant children. They play catch with
a large boulder ignoring the damage the do as the furniture is
pushed around the room. The room has serveral giant beds.
12620.name: The Barracks

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12629.name: Outlook Trail

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12631.name: Outlook Trail

description: Ducking into this room, you get a breather from the stench...
Obviously someone set this up for the purpose of storing whatever they
think they might need to dig thru the refuse down below.  Your only
way out is back into the piles of rot to the west...
12667.name: Utility Chute

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12623.name: Outlook Trail

description: Busy noise can be heard in the east. You can see a large building far
to the east decorated with many dragon skulls and hides of many animals.
To the north east is anothe large building with many windows cut into
it wooden walls. Movement can be seen in those windows and a little
laughter comes from them. In the south weast is a small dark building
with smoke rising above it, from time to time you hear hammer blows
enimating form this building.
12614.name: Inside the Gates

description: This is definitely the origin of that stench!  From here there are
two directions, Down toward the source of the stench, or East toward
fresh air....  The walls are coated in slime and maggots, and they
only seem to get worse as you go down.
12663.name: Refuse Chute

description: first room
move down to enter the maze
12611.name: Circle of Brush

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12638.name: 4h

description: Two tables are in the room one has 5 chairs around it
and one has only two well made chairs. On the roasting fire
is the carcase of a young Green Dragon.
12619.name: The Larder

description: The path passes around the side of the hill and then curves to the
left just before you lose track of it
A small group of buildings, possibly a market, can be seen nearby
This trail was made by some LARGE feet...
The trail here, tho well worn and wide, splits three ways.  To the
north the trail moves around the hill and back westward.  To the south
the trail passes over the other hill and out of view.  It also
continues eastward toward a bustling center of activity.
12606.name: Split in the Trail

description: The stench here is worse than it was above.  From below all you
smell is the refuse you get closer to as you go down...  Then you
notice a notch in the wall to the east from which a small amount of
fresh air seems to be coming.  Hmmm...
12665.name: Farther Down the Refuse Chute

description: The path continues around the wall of the fort. You can look down on the valleys
and hills surrounding the area. It seems all too peacefull.
12627.name: Outlook Trail

description: Here the source of the stench is found.  Piles and piles of pure
garbage feces and rotten food sit seeming to grow over each other...
Upon entry, the heads of any number of foul worms pop from the piles
and head your way.  Perhaps something should be done about that
12666.name: Depths of the Refuse Pit

description: The path contiues through the Roaming hills.
Silence seems to thicken as you walk on the path.
12670.name: Path between the Hills

description:
A Yellow Rot Grub feeds on the refuse thrown into
the garbage pit. It looks very well fed.
12620.room_name: A Hungry Rot Grub looks at his newest offering
12620.name: A Yellow Rot Grub~
subroutines:
F for ABO
F par AK

description:
Licking his chops, this beast seems to see only in you a morsel to
feed upon.  The Saddle he wears is MASSIVE, however that only shows
that he is the mount of a giant guard...  The look in his eye is one
of dastardly hunger...  Yet also a little bit of the wildness is
gone...
12621.room_name: An Ice White Dragon stands here licking his chops...
12621.name: an {CIce{x white dragon~

12622.name: Wilgig the Mad~
subroutines:
F for AHM
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

12623.name: a glowing white pile of jelly~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
Here stands a very large man-like beast who's look shows that of
pure morbid stupidity.  Perhaps he will be lucky with his swings and
hit you once or twice.  However, considering the size of those
muscles, that might prove to be quite painful...  He wears on his
chest a plate of metal that seems to have been ripped off of something
and hammered around his muscles.  He must think it's armor...
12600.room_name: A Hill Giant Sentinel guards the bastion from intruders
12600.name: A Giant Sentinel~

description:
A thorny vine with few leaves, this plant looks like every single
thorn is dripping with something. To the trained eye, it looks like saliva...
12601.room_name: A plant seems to be looking at you.
12601.name: A Thornslinger~
subroutines:
F vul I
F for GXc
F par ADEFKLQVX

12602.room_name: A Dire Wolf looks ready to eat you. He seems to stare into your eyes.
12602.name: A very large wolf seeing you growls and shows it's teeth~

12603.room_name: A hill Giant Priest offering sacrifices to the Groups God
12603.name: A Hill Giant Priest~

12604.room_name: Looking at you Choral grabs his mighty axe.
12604.name: Choral King of the Giants stands before you.~

12605.room_name: A giant lizard holds a rock in it's mouth and dances away from you
12605.name: a Giant Blue Lizard ready to play.~
subroutines:
F vul I
F for X
F par V

12606.room_name: A Giantess nurse made plays with the children and thier pets
12606.name: A Giantess wearing an aprin glares at you~

12607.room_name: A Giant Child is playing catch with thier pet lizards
12607.name: A Giant Child holds a large rock ready to throw it~
